input: The robotic arm can guarantee that if the object is fragile, then it will never exceed a maximum force.
reasoning: The prediction changes the temporal structure and the meaning of the condition. The prediction says: if fragile, then it is never the case that max_force eventually holds (!F (max_force)). This flips the meaning of the condition (force over limit vs. max_force being true) and uses a different temporal pattern (G !p vs. !F q) that does not guarantee the force stays below the limit at all times, only that max_force never becomes true eventually, which is semantically different.
